org.eng.aisp

Class SoundClip

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.util.InstanceIdentifiedObject
      • org.eng.aisp.AbstractDataWindow<double[]>
        • org.eng.aisp.DoubleWindow
          • org.eng.aisp.SoundClip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IDataWindow<double[]>, IDoubleWindow, IInstanceID

    public class SoundClip
extends DoubleWindow
implements Serializable, IDoubleWindow
    Stores the raw bits of a sound recording, modeled after PCM. Sound is stored in a byte array and is characterized by the number of channels, bits per sample, and samples per second. Data may be N-dimensional in which case it must be sampled at the same sampling rate and perfectly interleaved.

    Care should be taken when creating new instances. If possible, you should try to reuse and cache instances when possible in order to be able to leverage the InstanceIdentifiedObject.getInstanceID() based caching that goes on in in our FeatureExtractionPipeline and elsewhere.

    Author:
    dawood
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • bitsPerSample

        protected final int bitsPerSample

      • channels

        protected final int channels

      • interleavedDataDimensions

        protected int interleavedDataDimensions
        Defines the number of double values per reading. This is most often 1, but can be 3 for example for xyz accelerometer data.

      • pcmData

        protected transient byte[] pcmData

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundClip

        protected SoundClip()

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(int channels,
                 int bitsPerSample,
                 double samplesPerSecond,
                 byte[] pcmData)
        A convenience on SoundClip(double, int, int, double, byte[]) with start time set to the current time and assuming the pcmData is 1-dimensional.

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                 SoundClip clip)
        Used primarily in performance analysis to quickly copy a clip, but with a different start time.

        Care should be taken when creating new instances. If possible, you should try to reuse and cache instances when possible in order to be able to leverage the InstanceIdentifiedObject.getInstanceID() based caching that goes on in in our FeatureExtractionPipeline and elsewhere.
        Note, this has the side effect of decoding the PCM data in the given clip.

        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec -
        clip -

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(int interleavedDataDimensions,
                 SoundClip clip)
        Used to convert the interleave data count for a ciip, probably based on the DataTypeEnum. A convenience on #SoundClip(double, double, int, int, byte[], int) copying all data from the clip except the given interleavedDataDimensions.

        Shallow copy constructor.

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                 int channels,
                 int bitsPerSample,
                 double samplesPerSecond,
                 byte[] pcmData,
                 int sampleSize)
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec -
        channels -
        bitsPerSample -
        samplesPerSecond - the number of logical (multi-dimensional) samples per second.
        pcmData - the data representing the possibly multi-dimensional data.
        sampleSize - the size of each sample in the given data. Generally 1, but could be N for N-dimensional samples contained in the given data.

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                 byte[] wav)
          throws IOException
        Create the clip from a set of bytes representing a wav formatted audio.
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec - start time for this clip in milliseconds.
        wav - array of bytes holding a wav audio clip.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a format error in the byte array.

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                 double endTimeMsec,
                 double[] data,
                 int interleavedDataDimensions)
        A convenience on SoundClip(double, double, Vector, double[], int) with no independent data.

      • SoundClip

        public SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                 double endTimeMsec,
                 Vector independentData,
                 double[] data,
                 int interleavedDataDimensions)
        Create a SoundClip with single channel 16 bits/sample instance using the given data data, possibly interleaved with multiple data items, covering the given start and end times.
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec -
        endTimeMsec -
        independentData - optional data at which the given data is located.
        data - an array of values in the range -1 to 1 spanning the start and end time. N-dimensional data captured at the same sampling rate may be interleaved where N is defined by the interleavedDataDimensions parameter. Data is interleaved with no missing data so that for example, with N=2 data would contain (x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3...xN,yN) and interleavedDataDimensions would be set to 2.
        interleavedDataDimensions - if larger than 1, then the given data is N-dimensional data perfectly interleaved.

        } This is protected as it is discourage to provided all of start/stop time, sampling rate and data[] as the user could make those inconsistent.
        Parameters:

        endTimeMsec -
        samplingRate - the number of logical (i.e. possibly multi-dimensional) samples per second.
        independentData -
        data - the array of data containing the N-dimensional samples, per interleavedDataDimensions
        interleavedDataDimensions - the dimensionality of a sample.

      • SoundClip

        protected SoundClip(double startTimeMsec,
                    double endTimeMsec,
                    Vector independentData,
                    int channels,
                    int bitsPerSample,
                    double samplingRate,
                    byte[] pcmData,
                    int sampleSize)
        Protected in order to keep end users from providing all of start/stop time, sapmling rate, and pcmData[] which need to consistent.
        Parameters:
        startTimeMsec -
        endTimeMsec -
        independentData -
        channels -
        bitsPerSample -
        samplingRate - the logical sampling rate independent of the size of a sample, independent of the sample size.
        pcmData -
        sampleSize - the size of the N-dimensional vector sample contained in the given PCM data. Generally 1, but can be N for sample with N readings.

      • getPCMData

        public byte[] getPCMData()
        Get the sound samples as signed values. For 8-bit sampling rate, wav files contain unsigned values, but the values returned here will be signed. Calls decodePCMData() if necessary.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • decodePCMData

        public void decodePCMData()
        Turn the encoded PCM data that was encoded with #encodePCMData() into to the original byte[], that was the PCM data. On success, the instance is modified to contain a non-null byte[] for pcmDataand to clear the #encodedPCM.

      • getBitsPerSample

        public int getBitsPerSample()
        Get the number of bits/samples as would be seen in the PCM data (i.e. not a number of bits per logical sample).
        Returns:
        the bitsPerSample

      • getChannels

        public int getChannels()
        Get the number of channels as seen/represented in the PCM data.
        Returns:
        the channels

      • newSubWindow

        protected SoundClip newSubWindow(double newStartMsec,
                                 int startSampleIndex,
                                 int endSampleIndex)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataWindow
        Used by #subWindow(int, int) to create a new instance of a window that has the new start time and given data using the given logical indexes into the data. The new window is a subwindow of this instance and so should, in general, copy the sampling rate and context from this instance. The new end time can be computed from the new start time, sampling rate and amount of new data.
        Overrides:
        newSubWindow in class DoubleWindow
        startSampleIndex - first logical index (0-based) of sampled data to include in new window.
        endSampleIndex - last logical index, exclusive, of the sampled data to include in the window.
        Returns:

      • uncachedPad

        protected SoundClip uncachedPad(double durationMsec,
                                IDataWindow.PadType padType)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataWindow
        Create a new window of the requested length in which the data from this instance are the first samples in the returned window and the remaining samples are padded according to padType.
        Overrides:
        uncachedPad in class DoubleWindow
        Parameters:
        durationMsec - the length of the returned window. This will always be larger than the instance calling this method.
        Returns:
        null if padding is not supported/needed (for example SoundClipMetaData).

      • getWAVBytes

        public byte[] getWAVBytes()

      • getInterleavedDataDimensions

        public int getInterleavedDataDimensions()
        Get the number of dimensions in the data contained in this instance. When returning a value larger than 1, then the data is perfectly interleaved (xyzxyz...) and the amount of data is a multiple of the returned value.
        Returns:
